dict.acceptation: 越来越多地；日益，格外；越来越…；愈；

sent.orig: As call centers grow increasingly complex what constitutes effectiveness is increasingly difficult to measure.
sent.trans: 随着呼叫中心的运营变得越来越复杂，呼叫中心运营的有效性如何衡量也变得越来越困难。

sent.orig: Thereby higher latitude are prevented from becoming increasingly colder and low latitudes from becoming increasingly hotter.
sent.trans: 通过这种途径，使高纬地区不能变得越来越冷，而低纬地区不能变得越来越热。

sent.orig: At the same time, Chinese fans also increasingly sophisticated manufacturing and components increasingly perfect matching.
sent.trans: 同时，中国的风机制造业也日益成熟，零部件配套日渐完善。

sent.orig: We are likely to build an increasingly artificial, and hence increasingly knowable world.
sent.trans: 我们很有可能建造一个日益更加人为化，也因而渐渐更加可知的未来世界。

sent.orig: These tribes are being increasingly marginalised and in a certain sense much exploited the majority population.
sent.trans: 这些部族在一定程度上，受国内主要族裔人口剥削，逐渐被边缘化。
